info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 12:23PM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ***LONG DURATION HEAT WAVE LIKELY*** High pressure aloft will build into the area this weekend into next week and lasting, possibly, until at least the end of the month. Highs will warm as a result with most lowland locations expected to reach 95-105, possibly hotter, each day. Additionally, little relief is expected overnight, especially in urban areas with lows staying in the 70s. The hottest areas will be along the Rio Grande Valley, especially across Southern Dona Ana County into Texas. El Paso will see lows stay in the mid to upper 70s. The cumulative effect of heat with little overnight relief will compound the risk for heat-related illness. It is important to stay hydrated. Avoid excessive caffeine and alcohol consumption. If possible, shift outdoor activities toward the morning or later in the evening. Wear light colored, loose fitting clothing. Use sunscreen.
